Class RoomGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • RoomGenerator
  • public class RoomGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class of the Maze Project that builds a maze randomly or builds from file. This class also solves the maze via DFS and BFS. Run it and try out different numbers- recommended 20-30 because the size of your window may be too small
    Since:
    8-12-18

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RoomGenerator​(int n)
      Constructor given no file name
      RoomGenerator​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Constructor given a filename

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void breadthFirstSearch()
      Does BFS search path solving
      void buildMaze()
      Builds a random maze by randomly pairing rooms together until there exists a path between exit and entry points of the maze.
      void buildPathInMaze​(int room, int joiningRoom)
      Builds physical path in the maze 2D array
      void depthFirstSearch()
      Does DFS path solving
      void ensureOneConnectedComponent()
      This method ensures that all rooms in the maze are accessible.
      RoomEntry[][] getMaze()
      Returns the 2D RoomEntry array
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] arg)  
      void printBFS()
      Prints out the BFS Path from the bfs attribute.

      Prints out DFS Path from the array dfs attribute Should print the same as BFS path

      Quicksorts array recursively
      int randomAdjacentRoom​(int currentRoom)
      Chooses a random room adjacent to this current room in the maze
      void stdInit()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] arg)

      • stdInit

        public void stdInit()
        Standard maze initialization that both constructors use. Builds the empty full grid maze, initializes the RoomEntry objects in the array. Builds the QuickUnion and marks the entry and exit RoomEntry objects of the maze

      • getMaze

        public RoomEntry[][] getMaze()
        Returns the 2D RoomEntry array
        Returns:
        the maze or 2D array of RoomEntry

      • printDFS

        public void printDFS()
        Prints out DFS Path from the array dfs attribute Should print the same as BFS path

      • printBFS

        public void printBFS()
        Prints out the BFS Path from the bfs attribute. Should print the same as DFS path

      • buildMaze

        public void buildMaze()
        Builds a random maze by randomly pairing rooms together until there exists a path between exit and entry points of the maze.

      • ensureOneConnectedComponent

        public void ensureOneConnectedComponent()
        This method ensures that all rooms in the maze are accessible. This means the graph exists as a single connected component.

      • depthFirstSearch

        public void depthFirstSearch()
        Does DFS path solving

      • breadthFirstSearch

        public void breadthFirstSearch()
        Does BFS search path solving

      • buildPathInMaze

        public void buildPathInMaze​(int room,
                            int joiningRoom)
        Builds physical path in the maze 2D array
        Parameters:
        room - one room id
        joiningRoom - other room id

      • randomAdjacentRoom

        public int randomAdjacentRoom​(int currentRoom)
        Chooses a random room adjacent to this current room in the maze
        Parameters:
        currentRoom - the current room id
        Returns:
        the random adjacent room id to current room

      • quickSort

        public void quickSort​(RoomEntry[] array,
                      int start,
                      int end)
        Quicksorts array recursively
        Parameters:
        array - array to be sorted
        start - start index
        end - end index
